meanings.definition: The act of leaving property to someone in a will.
meanings.sent1: Her bequeathal to her niece included her antique jewelry collection.
meanings.sent2: The bequeathal of the estate caused some family disputes.
meanings.sent3: The bequeathal of the old mansion made the lawyer chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His bequeathal of wisdom to the next generation was his greatest gift.
meanings.sent5: The bequeathal of the family heirloom was a momentous occasion.

meanings.definition: Something that is bequeathed in a will.
meanings.sent1: The bequeathal of the painting surprised everyone in the family.
meanings.sent2: Receiving the bequeathal of the vintage car was a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent3: The bequeathal of the old clock brought a smile to their faces.
meanings.sent4: The bequeathal of the rare book was like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent5: The bequeathal of the family farm was a dream come true.
